intro: Galium uropetalum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pinkish flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Galium uropetalum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
